In light of the current national concerns and recent social media activity, the Board and administration of Georgetown County School District feel it is important to reiterate the District‚Äôs position on racism and racial discrimination.

The District prohibits discrimination based on race in all of its activities and programs, as required by federal and state law and District policy. Moreover, the District is mindful of the critical role it plays in shaping future generations and that our children learn how to interact with and respect one another in our schools. We take that responsibility seriously, and fully understand that this requires all employees to hold themselves to a higher standard. Further, District policy requires staff members to set the kind of example that will serve students well in managing their own conduct and behavior. This requirement applies to all conduct, including interactions on social media. These recent events provide us with the chance to renew our commitment to fairness, equality, and opportunity for all members of our community.
